page.title: 15EDUCATION IN BORDON
page.content: Bordon County Junior School began as "The Elder Children's School", in Barbados House in 1907. It was run by the army which appointed and paid the teachers. During the Great War the school building was occupied by Canadian Cavalry units and in the Second World War it was used as a military telephone exchange. Hampshire County Council took over Barbados House in 1953. In September 1956 it was opened as a junior school. From 1959-1961 all the 8-12 year olds attended Barbados House. During this time the present Weyford Infants School became the secondary school for children over 11. In September 1965 the junior school moved to Chalet Hill and Barbados House became the Infant's School. A new infant's school was opened in 1981 next to the junior school.
